repnme.cdata!:
Algeria - Basic and Secondary Education
            Support Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome was satisfactory,
            sustainability is likely, and institutional development
            impacts were modest. Positive lessons reinforce the
            importance of realistic project design in accordance with
            Government priorities, as well as that of government
            commitments, particularly from government officials directly
            involved in project activities, with a preparatory framework
            set prior to implementation, to significantly achieve
            success, as demonstrated in this operation. Nonetheless,
            negative lessons from this project point at the need to
            establish distinct output, and outcome indicators, as well
            as project impact indicators with a base value, and target
            value, to help assess the degree of achievement of the
            project's development objectives, and sustainability,
            particularly on those objectives of intangible nature, such
            as those relating to quality, and efficiency of the
            education system. To this end, it is worth undertaking an
            impact evaluation of the project, which should provide an
            objective analysis of achievements, and identify unexpected
            challenges. This could have benefited the project, given its
            restricted supervision. In addition, greater attention
            should have been paid to contractual enforcement, and
            include an action plan for handling cases of non-compliance
            with the loan agreement. Finally, as a general lesson,
            education projects should emphasize reform policies, in
            order to achieve significant impact.

5079385.trustfund:
TF020090-BELGIAN CONSULTANTS TRUST FUND,TF031409-TUNISIA ; ALGERIA - EDUCATION,TF033023-MENA REGION - EDUCATION
            (MOROCCO & ALGERIA),TF020250-FRENCH CONSULTANTS TRUST FUND

repnme.cdata!:
Algeria - Basic and Secondary Education
            Support Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The project is designed to support
            quality and efficiency improvements in the basic and
            secondary education subsector with replicable innovation and
            change at wilaya level.  The project will finance staff
            training and technical assistance, documentation, pedagogic
            materials and technical equipment.  The project will:  (a)
            assist the Ministry of National Education in improving its
            institutional capacity in assessing pupils' learning
            achievements and in measuring quality and efficiency in
            education by developing 6 groups of standard indicators; (b)
            support pedagogic research programs of the National
            Pedagogic Institute (IPN) through:  (i) institutional
            strengthening of the IPN; (ii) pedagogic research on design,
            lay-out and evaluation of curricula and schoolbook texts;
            (iii) provision of about 5,000 new library books, research
            journals and periodicals in pedagogic research areas
            relevant to IPN; (c) improve supply and use of pedagogic
            materials in schools through:  (i) provision of pedagogic
            materials to about 14,000 basic and secondary schools; (ii)
            improved provision and use of school science laboratory
            products in about 3,500 grade 7-12 shools and related
            technical equipment and staff training; and (iii) provision
            of spare parts, technical equipment, technical assistance,
            and staff training, and rehabilitation of maintenance
            facilities for improved maintenance services to schools.
